intro: Pedicularis sudetica var. gymnostachya, commonly known as the Alpine lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes various hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, often on rocky slopes or scree. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with a distinctive spurred shape that attracts pollinators like bees and flies. The species is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it is often found in association with other alpine flora.
